body_html: @dzhulgakov Yea, if you really need some utility then it should be possible to import it inside, or we can relax the constraint to allow importing torch/_utils.py. I think right now, with only minimal code changes, you can get the dependencies down to _single, _pair, _triple from torch.nn.utils, but if those are useful there then they should migrate to torch._utils anyway.
body_text: @dzhulgakov Yea, if you really need some utility then it should be possible to import it inside, or we can relax the constraint to allow importing torch/_utils.py. I think right now, with only minimal code changes, you can get the dependencies down to _single, _pair, _triple from torch.nn.utils, but if those are useful there then they should migrate to torch._utils anyway.
body: @dzhulgakov Yea, if you *really* need some utility then it should be possible to import it inside, or we can relax the constraint to allow importing `torch/_utils.py`. I think right now, with only minimal code changes, you can get the dependencies down to `_single`, `_pair`, `_triple` from `torch.nn.utils`, but if those are useful there then they should migrate to `torch._utils` anyway.
